alert.note: Alert for Charlotte; Halifax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:22PM EST until January 09 at 9:15PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Charlotte County in south central Virginia... Halifax County in south central Virginia... * Until 915 PM EST. * At 322 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... South Boston... Halifax... Brookneal... Keysville... Charlotte Court House... Phenix... Virgilina... This includes the following streams and drainages... Allen Creek, Ballous Creek, Armistead Branch, Banister River, Austin Creek, Aarons Creek, Bales Spring Branch and Ash Camp Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
